plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: Sunflowers are tall, bright plants known for their large, yellow flower heads that follow the sun's movement. They are widely cultivated for seeds and oil, and are a classic symbol of summer.
plants.bloomingSeason: Mid summer to early fall (July to September)
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, native to North America
plants.funFact: Sunflower heads can contain up to 2,000 individual flowers, each capable of producing a seed.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical flowering shrub commonly grown as an ornamental plant, producing large, vibrant flowers that thrive in warm climates during the summer months.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates, peak bloom in summer
plants.location: Tropical and subtropical regions worldwide, native to East Asia
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers are edible and often used to make traditional teas rich in antioxidants.

plants.name: Echinacea purpurea
plants.description: A perennial wildflower native to North America known for its distinctive purple petals and prominent spiny central cone, commonly found in prairies and wild gardens.
plants.bloomingSeason: Summer to early fall (June to September)
plants.funFact: Echinacea is widely used in herbal remedies believed to boost the immune system.

plants.name: Fuchsia magellanica
plants.description: A shrub with delicate, pendulous flowers, popular in gardens for its extended blooming period and attractive contrasting colors, thriving in cooler summer climates.
plants.location: Temperate regions of South America, cultivated worldwide in gardens
plants.funFact: Fuchsia flowers are favored by hummingbirds, serving as an important nectar source.
